Welcome to the most brilliant part of Bristol. We are situated on a street that is slap bang between Brandon Hill park and Park Street. Both are a huge fifteen second walk away!

Brandon Hill is a wonderful place from which to watch the International Hot Air Balloon Fiesta, an open air production of Shakespeare, or just have a walk through its waterfalls, woodland and meadow. There's a playground too and the paths lead you all the way down to the river Avon and the centre of town.

Park Street is a shopper's paradise. There are plenty of independent clothing stores (Kushty, BS8, The Guild) amongst the big names (Cath Kidson, Whistles, Jigsaw), indy record shops, and the original Boston Tea Party coffee shop on the corner of our street. There are plenty of wonderful bakeries, cafes, restaurants, and the great Bristol Museum is over the road.

The harbour and its markets, the Aquarium, Colston Hall, the SS Great Britain, the Watershed cinema, @Bristol
